      • getModel

      • isStart

        public boolean isStart()

      • userKeyInteraction

        public void userKeyInteraction(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
        This is how the View talks to the Controller AND how the Controller talks to the Model This method is called by the View to respond to key presses in the GUI
        The controller's job is to decide what to do. In this case it converts the keypresses into commands which are run in the model
        Parameters:
        event - KeyEvent from the keyboard

      • togglePause

        public void togglePause()
        Method responsible for the Pause button event. Pauses the game and changes the text displayed on the button.

      • toggleStart

        public void toggleStart()
        This method restarts the whole game when RESTART GAME button is pressed.
        This button is hidden until the game is over.

      • toggleLogin

        public void toggleLogin()
        Method responsible for pressing the login button.
        Checks if user name typed at least one character to login.
        Writes name to the hash map, sets score accordingly

      • fromFile

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> fromFile(java.lang.String path)
        This method writes from the text file "userScores.txt" into the HashMap, adds players names and scores
        Resources: https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/reading-text-file-into-java-hashmap/
        Parameters:
        path - this is a path to the file
        Returns:
        HashMap that is initialised in The View class

      • toFile

        public void toFile()
        This method writes from the hashMap into the text file "userScores.txt", adds values on each line separated by the colon
        Resources: https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/write-hashmap-to-a-text-file-in-java/
